definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to introduce oneself/originally a theatrical device in which a character explains his own role
people who don't belong together, don't get to live together (idiom)/marriages are predestined/people marry because they share common traits
pinyin: bu4 shi4 yi1 jia1 ren2 bu4 jin4 yi1 jia1 men2
containing_words.word: 不是一家人不进一家门

sentences.english: So they drove Boner out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他们把邦德赶出了家门。

sentences.english: Thereafter, the son of a father adamantly refused to re-enter the home.
sentences.chinese: 此后，父亲坚决拒绝儿子一家再进这个家门。

sentences.english: He hunted his pet dog out of his house.
He was supplanted out of the house by his wife.
It was dinnertime when Reuben got home.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭时分，鲁本跨进家门。

sentences.english: Hearing we will go out to play, my little niece jumped and leapt out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 去玩，我的小侄子连蹦带跳地跑出了家门。

sentences.english: We haven't left home for a week.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一周没出家门了。

sentences.english: We had come out, but not into freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我们走出了家门，但并没有走进自由。

sentences.english: Many firecrackers hanging on walls in the daytime ready to send the coffin up the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 发殡那天村里很多家门口都要挂上鞭炮送老人上山。

sentences.english: Nobody wants a dump, or an incinerator, next door.
sentences.chinese: 谁都不愿在自己的家门口有个垃圾场或垃圾焚化炉。

sentences.english: Dang, Cletus, why'd you have to park by my parents?
sentences.chinese: 克莱特斯，你为什么非要停在我爸妈家门口？

sentences.english: The big bus filled with passengers suddenly stopped at my door.
sentences.chinese: 载满了乘客的大巴忽然停在我家门口。

sentences.english: The singer left home and hailed a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 歌星出了家门，打车去酒店。

sentences.english: ROM. Mulberry day immediately went to the door.
sentences.chinese: 罗桑天立即赶到了胡玉成家门口。

sentences.english: If you subscribe to the newspaper,it’ll be delivered to your door.
sentences.chinese: 假如你预定了这种报纸，就有人会送到你家门口。

sentences.english: I can see through the gate of that house the gardener digging the ground.
sentences.chinese: 从一家门口，我看得见一个园丁在那里掘地。

definition: to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to pass through a doorway/(of a woman) to marry/orchestral music interlude in an opera
